Title: Randomised Controlled Trial of cHuR as a Predictive Marker for Chemotherapy Response in Pancreatic Ductal Adenocarcinoma

Background: This study evaluated cytoplasmic HuR (cHuR) as a predictive marker for chemotherapy response in resected pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDA) patients. Previous studies suggested HuR's potential as a biomarker, but lacked clinical trial validation.

Methods: In this randomised controlled trial, 379 PDA patients from the European Study Group of Pancreatic Cancer-3 trial were included. Participants were randomised to receive either gemcitabine (GEM) or 5-fluorouracil (5-FU) as adjuvant monotherapy. Tissue samples were immunolabeled for cHuR expression, and patients were dichotomized into high and low cHuR expression groups. The primary outcome was disease-free survival (DFS), measured over a specified timeframe.

Results: No association was found between cHuR expression and prognosis in the overall cohort (DFS, P = 0.44; overall survival, P = 0.41). However, patients with high cHuR expression had significantly greater median DFS with 5-FU compared to GEM (20.1 months, CI: 8.3–36.4 vs 10.9 months, CI: 7.5–14.2; P = 0.04). Median DFS was similar between treatment arms in patients with low cHuR expression.

Interpretation: High cHuR-expressing tumors may benefit from 5-FU-based adjuvant therapy compared to GEM, while low cHuR expression shows no survival advantage between treatments. Further studies are needed to validate HuR as a biomarker. Trial registration and funding details were not provided.
